EXTRACTED VALUE: Greg Monroe played 27 minutes and hit 3-of-6 shots for six points, two rebounds, four assists and a steal on Friday.
Ben Wallace had four points, 11 rebounds, one assist, four steals and a block in Tuesday's preseason win.
Andris Biedrins left Thursday's game with an upset stomach.
D.J. White double-doubled with 12 points, 13 rebounds and two blocks in a start for Thunder on Tuesday.
Earl Barron started at power forward again for the Suns on Friday, but had just six points and two rebounds.
Knicks coach Mike D'Antoni confirmed that Anthony Randolph might not crack the rotation in the near future.
Chris Kaman will not play on Monday against the Kings, and will have an MRI taken Tuesday to determine how bad he re-injured it during Sunday's game.
Hasheem Thabeet started for the Grizzlies vs. the Hornets on Saturday, but he picked up five fouls in just 14 minutes.
Wizards first-round pick Kevin Seraphin reached a buyout agreement with his French team, and is set to sign with the Wizards.
Sam Young took advantage of injuries to Marc Gasol and Zach Randolph, finishing with 17 points, five boards, three steals and a 3-pointer Wednesday.
The Knicks could end up starting Roger Mason at shooting guard and Amare Stoudemire at center.
Nene had a season-high 24 points, nine rebounds, two steals and a block on 8-of-9 shooting in Wednesday's win over the Bucks.
Devin Harris (knee) showed his usual explosiveness in practice on Monday and should be fine going forward.
Hedo Turkoglu moved to the Suns' bench on Sunday, finishing with 13 points (6-of-13 shooting), one 3-pointer, and four assists in 27 minutes.
Chris Andersen (bruised back) will not play on Sunday and is questionable for Tuesday.
Melvin Ely started in place of injured Nene on Friday and had five points and eight boards in 30 minutes.
Josh Childress, who is just 0-of-4 from downtown this season, may soon play some PF off the Suns bench.
Jawad Williams returned from a personal absence Tuesday and had 12 points, four boards and two 3-pointers in a win over Philly.
Anthony Morrow scored seven points on 3-of-6 shooting (including a three) with two rebounds and one assist against the Knicks on Tuesday.
DeAndre Jordan had four points, 13 rebounds and three blocks in Wednesday's shocking win over the Spurs.
Zach Randolph had 19 points and 19 rebounds in Wednesday's loss to the Hawks.
Marcus Camby was benched by coach Nate McMillan on Friday, reportedly for a lack of hustle.
Rudy Fernandez failed to score in six minutes before leaving Friday's game after being kicked in the groin.
Robin Lopez (knee) took some shots on Wednesday, but is reportedly still at least two weeks away from returning to action.
Craig Smith hit 8-of-9 shots for 18 points and four rebounds in Friday's loss.
Manny Harris has been impressive this preseason, and had seven points with six rebounds in 20 minutes against CSKA Moscow on Saturday.
Kris Humphries had six points, 15 rebounds, two steals and two blocks in Wednesday's triple-overtime loss to the Thunder.
Leandro Barbosa hit 7-of-12 shots and two 3-pointers for 22 points and two steals in Friday's win.
Grant Hill, who suffered a foot sprain in Wednesday's practice, will play in Thursday's game at Golden State.
J.J. Hickson returned to Cleveland's starting lineup on Sunday, but had just seven points, two rebounds, and five turnovers in 16 ineffective minutes.
Pistons PF Jason Maxiell played just 12 minutes on Sunday, and was benched (for Ben Gordon) to start the second half.
Chauncey Billups (wrist) sat out most of Tuesday's practice but is fully expected to play Wednesday.
Troy Murphy played 22 minutes and had one point and eight rebounds in Friday's loss.
Antawn Jamison tied his season-high with 22 points on Sunday, making 8-of-17 FGs with six rebounds and one steal in 31 minutes.
The Clippers signed second-round pick Willie Warren on Tuesday.
Clippers forward Brian Cook was ejected from Sunday's game after committing a Flagrant-2 foul on Joel Przybilla.
Rodney Stuckey had 17 points, three rebounds, seven assists, one steal, and four turnovers in a road victory against the Kings on Sunday.
Anthony Parker says the fingers on his right (shooting) hand are still bothering him.
Arron Afflalo scored 15 points on 6-of-10 shooting (including three 3-pointers) with nine rebounds, two assists, and two blocks on Monday.
John Wall returned to the starting lineup on Friday and finished with 10 points, four rebounds and a season-low two assists on 3-of-13 shooting.
Coach Jay Triano said that rookie PF Ed Davis' playing time will simply depend on how he performs when he's on the floor.
Charlie Villanueva will not play against the Rockets Tuesday for personal reasons.
Al Harrington missed all four of his shots on Friday to finish with just three points and six boards in 23 minutes.
Hornets wingman Julian Wright is refusing to play for the Hornets summer league team, despite the wishes of new coach Monty Williams.
Andre Miller left Friday's game after spraining his left ankle but returned to start the second half.
Wizards guard Nick Young returned from a thigh injury on Sunday, scoring 20 points on 8-of-14 shooting, including two 3-pointers.
Jordan Farmar hit just 6-of-18 shots, but also hit a 3-pointer and had 16 points and 10 assists in Friday's loss to the Bobcats.
Reggie Williams hit 6-of-10 shots and two 3-pointers for 15 points on Wednesday.
Nick Collison's new four-year extension is worth just over $11 million, sources tell ESPN.com.
The Nuggets and coach George Karl are discussing a contract extension that could keep him in Denver through 2011-12 and beyond.
Gary Forbes scored four points on 2-of-2 shooting with one rebound and one assist in 11 minutes off the bench.
Danilo Gallinari hit just 2-of-6 shots in 23 minutes for four points in Saturday's loss to the Hawks.
Updating an earlier item, Reggie Evans will have surgery on his fractured foot on Thursday.
Kevin Durant returned on Sunday after missing two games with a sprained knee, scoring 28 points with seven rebounds, three assists, and two blocks.
Sonny Weems missed all nine of his shots and failed to score in 18 minutes on Friday.
The Memphis Commercial Appeal confirms that Tony Allen's ankle injury is mild.
Nets guard Quinton Ross (calf) missed another game on Sunday and is day-to-day.
Joe Smith is expected to start at power forward for the Nets in Wednesday's season opener.
Alonzo Gee and Hilton Armstrong will start for injured John Wall (knee) and JaVale McGee (back) in Monday's game against the Heat.
Thabo Sefolosha started and played 23 minutes, but didn't score and managed just three rebounds, two assists and a steal.
Chris Wilcox, who injured his hamstring during the preseason, is expected to make his season debut Sunday against the Kings.
Randy Foye played five minutes despite a hamstring injury Thursday, but failed to score.
Channing Frye may continue to start for Phoenix even after Robin Lopez (knee) returns from injury this month.
Ryan Hollins made a start at center in Thursday's loss and finished with six points, 14 rebounds, a steal and two blocks.
Charlie Bell was suspended for Game 7 because he was late to a team meeting.
Wesley Matthews avoided suspension on Monday after possibly leaving the bench area during a fracas on Sunday night.
Johan Petro started in place of Brook Lopez (rest) and had eight points, seven rebounds and two blocks in Wednesday's loss to the Celtics.
Hamed Haddadi hasn't joined the Grizzlies for training camp because legal issues have prevented his departure from Iran.
Earl Clark returned to the Suns' active roster on Sunday after spending three games with their D-League affiliate in Iowa.
Marc Gasol had 20 points, seven rebounds, five assists, two steals and three blocks on 7-of-9 shooting on Friday.
Linas Kleiza saw just 10 minutes of action on Sunday against the Knicks, failing to score after missing his only two field-goal attempts of the game.
DeMar DeRozan and Sonny Weems both started for the victorious Raptors on Wednesday, but neither played well.
Thunder center Byron Mullens and guard Mustafa Shakur were assigned to Tulsa 66ers on Friday.
Wilson Chandler shot 8-of-14 to score 21 points in Sunday's win over the Raptors, adding three treys, three rebounds, one assist and one turnover.
Hakim Warrick came to life with 26 points off the bench on Sunday, making 10-of-13 FGs and 6-of-10 FTs, with six rebounds and two assists.
Greivis Vasquez (ankle) made his Grizzlies debut on Saturday, playing three minutes without logging any statistics other than a missed shot.
Raptors second-round C Solomon Alabi, who suffers from Hepatitis B, is not expected to be hampered at all by his illness.
JaVale McGee had just two points and six rebounds in his worst game in weeks on Sunday.
Dan Gadzuric grabbed 11 rebounds on Monday, but managed just one point on 0-for-6 shooting in 12 minutes off the bench.
Wizards C Hilton Armstrong has been suspended one game for shoving Heat C Joel Anthony on Monday.
Austin Daye is not expected to return to the Pistons' rotation this week.
Al Thornton returned from an ankle injury on Wednesday and was scoreless in six minutes.
Peja Stojakovic (knee) will not dress for Sunday's game against the Knicks.
Sean Marks is active for Wednesday's game at Boston.
Coach Vinny Del Negro provided no update on Baron Davis' hamstring injury Monday night, saying I don't know how bad it is.
Nets GM Billy King did not rule out the possibility of Terrence Williams returning to the major league club for Thursday's game in Dallas.
Anthony Carter will sign a one-year deal worth about a million dollars to stay with the Nuggets.
Landry Fields, a starting shooting guard, had 15 points, 11 rebounds and a 3-pointer on 6-of-10 shooting in Saturday's loss to the Hawks.
Warriors forward Dorell Wright played all 48 minutes of Sunday's loss, tallying 12 points (one 3-pointer), 11 rebounds, two assists, and two blocks.
J.R. Smith cooled off with just five points on 1-of-8 shooting in Sunday's game, adding three rebounds in 19 minutes of action.
LaMarcus Aldridge scored 20 points on 9-of-20 shooting with 12 rebounds (seven offensive), three assists, and a steal in Tuesday's loss to the Sixers.
The Cavaliers have officially signed undrafted rookie Samardo Samuels.
Patrick Mills will likely start for Andre Miller (suspension) on Tuesday, according to coach Nate McMillan.
Vladmir Radmanovic will start for injured David Lee (elbow) against the Pistons on Monday.
Eric Maynor suffered a thumb injury in summer-league play that could keep him out for the remainder of OKC's games.
Darrell Arthur (groin) missed Wednesday's game against the Lakers and remains day to day.
The Knicks have made inquiries to other teams about acquiring an affordable backup point guard, to keep Raymond Felton fresh.
Joey Graham will not play in Saturday's game against the Wolves due to the flu.
Travis Outlaw, perhaps the most inconsistent scorer in the league, hit just 1-of-12 shots for three points and seven rebounds on Wednesday.
Thunder assigned C Cole Aldrich to the Tulsa 66ers of the D-League.
Morris Peterson had just nine points and five boards in 27 minutes on Wednesday.
Free agent swingman Stephen Graham is drawing interest from the Bobcats, Heat, Grizzlies, and Clippers.
Jamario Moon is starting at SF for the Cavs, but he isn't playing much during the fourth quarters of games.
Xavier Henry scored nine points on 4-of-9 shooting (including a three) with two rebounds, no assists, and one block in 22 minutes on Saturday.
Eric Bledsoe will start at PG for Monday's game against the Kings, and Baron Davis will come off the bench.
Knicks signed second-round G Andy Rautins.
The Timberwolves selected PF Trevor Booker with the 23rd pick in the draft, but will trade him to the Wizards.
The Thunder have signed free agent guard Royal Ivey.
Unexpectedly, Joey Dorsey - not Amir Johnson - will start in place of Reggie Evans (fractured right foot) for Sunday's game against the Knicks.
Jared Dudley went 5-of-8 to score 15 points in 20 minutes off the bench Sunday. He added six rebounds and a steal.
Joel Przybilla finally made his season debut on Friday and had four points and seven rebounds in 20 minutes.
Warriors forward Brandan Wright (sore lower back) might return for Tuesday�s home game against the Spurs.
Andray Blatche scored 24 points on 10-of-13 shooting in Sunday's loss to the Suns.
Nicolas Batum will start in place of Andre Miller (suspension) against the Suns Tuesday.
Yi Jianlian had one of his best games of the season on Sunday, notching 13 points and nine rebounds in 26 minutes off the bench.
